title: Ezra Reads the Law
summary: Ezra reads the Law of Moses to the people, who listen attentively. Levites help explain the meaning. The people weep in conviction, but Nehemiah and Ezra encourage them to rejoice because it is a holy day.

faq.question: How did the people respond to hearing the Law?
faq.answer: They were convicted and wept, but were also encouraged to rejoice in God's Word.

faq.question: What was the significance of this moment?
faq.answer: It was a spiritual revival centered on Scripture and understanding.
